intro: Rogeria microcarpa, commonly known as the dwarf rogeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments and prefers well-drained soil. Rogeria microcarpa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in containers.
